definition: to be totally oblivious (to sth)/to have no idea about sth

sentences.english: What the little boys didn't know was that a second train was heading straight for them.
sentences.chinese: 另一列火車正朝他們駛過來，兩個小男孩卻渾然不知。

sentences.english: The sorrow of all sorrows is the ignorance of one's ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 人世間最大的悲哀，莫過於對自身的無知渾然不知。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, YangManLi also hinted hao's mother, jing jing ni hao was unaware.
sentences.chinese: 其間，楊曼莉還暗示郝京妮的母親，郝京妮渾然不知。

sentences.english: But not knowing, why did I begin to write?
sentences.chinese: 然而，我渾然不知時，我爲什麼動筆寫作？

sentences.english: It turns out I had this book in my collection all along without knowing its significance.
sentences.chinese: 原來我早就收藏了這本書，卻渾然不知其重要。

sentences.english: The whole time you're mad, the person you're upset toward is totally oblivious to it.
sentences.chinese: 整日處於瘋狂狀態，令你心煩之人卻對此渾然不知。
